== Main Inclusion Report for libplist ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libp/libplist]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Required by libiphone and the new gvfs afc backend
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=libplist|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: no CVE entry
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=libplist|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: no secunia history
** No non user binaries, no daemon
** Local library
** Does process binaries and xml from apple devices
** Any source code review performed ? No
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package works out of the box, it's a library used by libiphone
** No debconf question
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:libplist|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: No open bug
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libp/libplist.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> was inactive but got a new maintainer recently
** <nowiki>[[http://github.com/JonathanBeck/libplist|Upstream]]</nowiki> seems reasonable active (recent 1.0 version)
** <nowiki>[[http://libiphone.lighthouseapp.com/projects/27916-libiphone/tickets?q=all|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: 6 open tickets only nothing looking a real issue
** Hardware: the package deals with apple devices
** test dir in the source but that doesn't seem to be a real testsuite, not run during the build
0. ''UI standards:''
** The library is not something the user interact directly with, no translation
** No translation template to update
** No desktop file
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system: standard debhelper, no patch system set yet
0. ''Dependencies:''
** libc6, libglib2.0-0, libxml2, all in main
0. ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need ? Library in 1.0 version and in direct sync from Debian, should be easy to maintain in Ubuntu
** Who is responsible for monitoring the quality of this package and fixing its bugs ? Debian and Ubuntu Desktop Team will look at issues impact on the gvfs backend
** Who is the package bug contact in Ubuntu? The desktop team
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package us clear from the package's debian/control file.
** What do upstream call this software ?  Has it had different names in the past ? libplist, no previous naming
0. ''Internationalization:''
** The library doesn't interact with users directly and has no translations
